result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Court Appointed Attorneys Fees
Approving Attorney Fees - Forwarded as document for review to Controller
Hearing on December 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Krsticevic in court with attorney Mark A. Langholz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes finding that defendant is not competent based on report filed with the court. State requests 30 day extension for extradition. Court so orders. Counsel requests order for discharge. If a Governor's warrant has not been issued in case 16CF352 within 30 days; defendant to be released of all bail condititions.  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 01:15 pm on extradition case 16CF352.
Letter of defendant

Case not called on the record. Defendant in court on 16CF352 with bail set at $1000 signature bond on fugitive complaint/warrant. Clerk confirmed with Court that bail was not previously set on this case due to competency of defendant. Court will make a finding on 12/29/16 as to competency of the defendant.
Hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael J Krsticevic in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed there is an extraditable warrant from Indiana from 1990's. Court is further informed defendant will not be able to return to Mendota. DHS has talked to their facility. Sheriff's Dept/DHS/Atty. Stansbury to investigate the options for Mr. Krsticevic, court adjourns hearing to November 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Clerk informed defendant will need to appear on 11/22/2016. Sheriff's Dept notified to transport/Atty. Stansbury/DA notified.
Clerk confirmed with Atty. Stansbury, DA, defendant need not appear in court on 11/22/2016. Jail notified.
Order to Produce Defendant in person/in custody for 11/22/16 hearing.  2 Certified copies forwarded to Corp Gahan.
Further proceedings on November 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel/Court have reviewed the latest report. Court schedules 11/22/2016 court date but may move sooner.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Duplicate Competency Report was filed with copies (faxed copy received 9/30/16).  Copy forwarded to DA's office and to Atty. Stansbury.
Forwarded to Branch 1 clerk's document review.
Further proceedings on October 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court accepts psychologists report filed 7/11/2016. Court accepts report and continues placement of defendant, finds his competency is not restored at this time but may be restored.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Scanned/Forwarded to Branch 1 clerk. Copies also provided to the District Attorney's office and defense counsel.
Scanned and forwarded as document for review to Judge Malloy.  Copy forwarded to DA's office and Atty. Stansbury.
Further proceedings on August 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury in court, defendant, Michael J. Krsticevic not in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests the the Court adopt the recommendation of the report.  Response by Attorney Stansbury. 
Further proceedings scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Copy emailed to DA and to Atty Stansbury this date
Further proceedings on June 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Case removed from today's calendar, defendant is waiting for transfer under the Order of Commitment. Therefore, dr. report is not filed.
To Michael Krsticevic regarding recoupment of attorney fees.
Check request sent to finance department for payment of attorney fees - $301.00 - Attorney Stansbury.

Status hearing at 04-19-2016 03:00 pm
Order for Commitment for Treatment
Copy of Order of Commitment faxed to Atty. Stansbury, copy to DA. Copy of complaint, Order, dr. report faxed to mental health facility.

Defendant Michael J Krsticevic in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury, appearing as standby counsel.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not contest physicians report. DA reviewed report, does not contest the reports findings. Court accepts the findings of physicians report. Atty. Stansbury to be allowed telephone contact with defendant. Additional report to be filed w/in 90 days.  Atty. Stansbury to submit his fees for Court approval.
Copy of competency report forwarded to DA/Atty. Stansbury.
Scanned and forwarded to Branch 1 for review.
Defendant's
Atty. Douglas Stansbury will accept appointment as standby counsel. Bail form not signed by defendant since Court did not set bail.

Defendant Michael J Krsticevic in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant stated he will represent himself. Atty. Alme Boaz was present and court examines her as to defendant's competency. Court orders competency evaluation to be completed within 30 days. Court will appoint standby counsel. Court finds probable cause in the complaint. Court does not set bond amount.  Status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
